ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:16): IE6 doesn't simply remove the second <title> - see e.g. http://software.hixie.ch/utilities/js/live-dom-viewer/?%3C%21DOCTYPE%20HTML%3E%0D%0A%3Chtml%3E%0D%0A%3Chead%3E%0D%0A%3Ctitle%3EOne%3C/title%3E%0D%0A%3C/head%3E%0D%0A%3Cbody%3E%0D%0A%3Ctitle%20id%3Dt%3ETwo%3C/title%3E%0D%0A%3Cscript%3Ewindow.onload%20%3D%20function%20%28%29%20%7B%20alert%28document.getElementById%28%27t%27%29.innerHTML%29%20%7D%3C/script%3E
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:17): where it assigns the second title's id to the first title's content
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:17): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, ah, it handles <title> like <html>
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:17): (at a guess(
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:18): although not entirely... :(
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:19): it seems to only copy known attributes
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:20): Does it copy any except for id?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:20): title=, class= but not x=
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:21): no browser seems to copy that though
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:21): and what I thought about <html> only works in Firefox
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:22): and Opera
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:23): browsers are insane
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:23): Copies lang too
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:24): yeah, known attributes
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:24): "known"
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (16:24): [15:27]  &lt e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0> browsers are insane
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (16:24): hmmm yes, let's kill all browsers and use papernet.
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:25): paper has other issues
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:26): Paper can't express semantics
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (16:32): is trying to imagine the world we had before computers and is trying to guess what was not semantic

08c1245f70464580d6323e90f7b902f2 (16:32): f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb: iCab shows this under DOM view (note 'misparented'): <ul class="domTree"><LI CLASS="t1 misparented"><CODE>BODY</CODE></LI></ul>
08c1245f70464580d6323e90f7b902f2 (16:34): f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb: ... which is assigned if this test is false: (node.childNodes[i].parentNode == node)
08c1245f70464580d6323e90f7b902f2 (16:35): realizes that's taken out of context, but anyway ...
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:35): oh, iCab has a graph as opposed to a tree?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:35): interesting
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (16:38): Is it just me or do people not understand that scope= addresses similar use cases to headers=?
08c1245f70464580d6323e90f7b902f2 (16:39): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: ah, is that it? a directed graph then.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (16:39): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: maybe it is just a *different* way of looking at same things, more than a wrong/right case.
